feed.title: MSU SPARK Group
feed.subtitle: The Zhong Lab is a team of researchers at Michigan State University dedicated to exploring fundamental science and creating new possibilities for energy and chemical conversion. We bring together expertise in Spectroscopy, Plasmas, and Reaction Kinetics to spark new ideas, create new tools, and integrate these capabilities to tackle grand energy challenges and explore new frontiers.

entry.title: Dr. Zhong chaired sessions at AIAA SciTech 2026

link.title: Dr. Zhong chaired sessions at AIAA SciTech 2026

entry.content: Dr. Zhong attended AIAA SciTech 2026 (Orlando, FL) and chaired two sessions “TES-03, Novel Propulsion Technologies for Alternative Fuels” and “PDL-02, Plasma-assisted Ignition and Combustion II”.
entry.summary: Dr. Zhong attended AIAA SciTech 2026 (Orlando, FL) and chaired two sessions “TES-03, Novel Propulsion Technologies for Alternative Fuels” and “PDL-02, Plasma-assisted Ignition and Combustion II”.

entry.title: SPARK presented at MIPSE Graduate Student Symposium 2025

link.title: SPARK presented at MIPSE Graduate Student Symposium 2025

entry.content: SPARK members (Wencheng Lin, Sankhadeep Basu) presented their work at 16th Annual MIPSE Graduate Student Symposium at the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor. Check out this Link!
entry.summary: SPARK members (Wencheng Lin, Sankhadeep Basu) presented their work at 16th Annual MIPSE Graduate Student Symposium at the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor. Check out this Link!

entry.title: Our PCRF proposal was accepted!
entry.content: SPARK’s collaborative research (user) proposal “Understanding the Non-Equilibrium Hydrogenation Mechanism for Biodiesel Up-conversion” to the Princeton Collaborative Low Temperature Plasma Research Facility (PCRF) has been accepted and will be given a runtime on our Facility in FY25/26 (2025).
entry.summary: SPARK’s collaborative research (user) proposal “Understanding the Non-Equilibrium Hydrogenation Mechanism for Biodiesel Up-conversion” to the Princeton Collaborative Low Temperature Plasma Research Facility (PCRF) has been accepted and will be given a runtime on our Facility in FY25/26 (2025).
